title: So are they just giving Katarina the Riven treatment?

embed.description: This is a WORK IN PROGRESS POST - Today' s Patch out but the PBE still down ] The PBE has been updated! Continue reading for more information! ( Warning: PBE Content is tentative and iterative - what you see may not reflect what eventually gets pushed to live servers!

body:
Katarina
Base HP reduced to 510 from 560
HP growth per level increased to 83 from 80
Base HP regen per second reduced to .9 from 1.5748
^taken from S@20

Isn't that exactly like what they did with Riven to "nerf" her? Except Riven was supposed to rely on her shield to not take damage.

replies.body: I like it. Accentuate her weakness of being kept down in lane by heavy poke. She trades far too well in lane for being such a snowbally mid-game assassin. Who cares if it is similar to Riven?

Katarina is supposed to use her CC in order to mitigate the damage she takes from the enemy team.

She has no CC you say? To the contrary, I offer:

>Death is the ultimate CC.
Against Karthus you really want a silence...

So she basically has 1 level less base HP. And will have 1 more HP at level 18. HP regen stat is just a joke. It doesn't really count for anything.

Not impressed. But maybe ti will make bullying her early a little easier.

I call BS. decreasing her sustain does decrease her trading power. 

The thing to note is, Health is a Resource for all champions, Regardless of whether you use it to cast spells or not. Your health measures how long you can stay in a fight, how long you can dive a tower, etc. So in this sense, No champion is truely Resourceless.

While I don't disagree that sustain is relevant, the sustain granted by innate HP regen is completely outclassed by every other form of healing in the game.

For example, Warwick's HP/5 at level 18 is a mere 22HP, while his base HP is 2259. Its less than 1% of his base HP pool. So it would take 513.4 seconds to fully regen his entire HP pool. That's 8.55 minutes.

Now lets look at Braum, someone that builds HP and regen as a matter of course with Face of the Mountain, a recommended item for him. At level 18, he has 2055 base HP and a regen rate of 25.2 hp/5. Add {{item:3401}} for +500 HP and +100% regen. That puts him at 2555 and +50.4 HP/5, which is about 10HP/second. That comes to 253.47 second to fully regen. 4.22 minutes.

Add in a {{item:3065}} . +400 Health, another 100% regen for a total of 200%, which is then multiplied by 20% for a total of 240%; and you get 2955 and 85.68HP/5 or 17.136 HP/sec.

Things get a little more interesting when you stack a {{item:3083}} because of its 3% of max health regen out of combat. Also +800 health. Add that in and we're getting 3755HP. Redoing the math we get 200% base regen (75.6HP/5), 3% of max health (112.65 HP/5), and all of that multiplied by 20% for 90.72+135.18=225.9hp/5 or 45.18hp/s.

HP regen is a joke in all but the most heavily HP-stacked builds. {{item:3153}} 8% HP shred completely counters those. Riot could remove every instance of it from the game and no one would ever notice, with the sole exception of ability heals.
lol someone is very much underestimating the hp regen stat

Sometimes I think they really need to just nuke everything and start over. I know that Kat's current AP AoE mage kit (the manaless mage - LOL) isn't consistent with their vision for her anyway.

It doesn't make sense for spry, athletic champions like Katarina and Riven to frail and sickly, and I'll be surprised if further weakening Katarina's already very weak early laning affects her gameplay or ban/pick rates at all.

Take a close look at Katarina's E.

Also, remember a large chunk of Katarina's match ups are going to be projectile mages; notice how she Shunpos *behind* targets.
